Confidential Information is any information or materials concerning the Firm’s affairs, whether business, technical or otherwise, which are not known to the public at large. It includes, but is not limited to, information and materials developed, collected or used by the Firm personnel; information disclosed to

by its clients or potential clients in the course of engagements or proposed engagements; and information disclosed by third parties with which the Firm has or may have a business relationship. Confidential Information may relate to the past, present or future and may concern, but is not limited to, business strategies, financial data, business plans, technology, contract provisions, client lists or records, computer printouts and disks, or other forms of documentation or media. However, it need not necessarily be reduced to a tangible form.

3. I agree that I shall have no proprietary interest in any idea, invention, design technical or business innovation, computer program and related documentation, or any other work product developed, conceived, or used by me, in whole or in part that arises out of my employment with the Firm, or that are otherwise made through the use of the Firm’s time or materials (all of the foregoing hereinafter referred to collectively as “Developments”). I acknowledge that all Developments are and shall be the sole property of the Firm and that the Firm is not required to designate me as the author thereof. I shall promptly disclose all Developments to the Staff Partner of the office to which I am assigned and shall, at the Firm’s request, do all the things that may be necessary and appropriate to establish or document the Firm’s ownership of the Developments, including, but not limited to the execution of the appropriate copyright or patent applications or assignment.
